algorithm_technique: Iterate through half of rows/columns, count mismatches, take minimum.
problem_summary_simple: Flip minimum cells to make all rows or all columns palindromic.
problem_summary_technical: Calculates flips for row palindromes and column palindromes independently, then returns the minimum.
key_insights: The problem can be solved by considering rows and columns separately.
For each row/column, the minimum flips to make it palindromic is the count of differing pairs of elements.
The lambda function is used to abstract the access pattern for rows and columns.
